info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 2 at 3:59PM MDT until July 2 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Southwestern Otero County in south central New Mexico... Southeastern Dona Ana County in south central New Mexico...
* Until 500 PM MDT.
* At 358 PM MDT, a wall of blowing dust was along a line extending from , moving northwest at 40 mph.
HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong winds up to 40 mph.
SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes the following highways... Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 164 and 173. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 3 and 25.
Locations impacted include... Chaparral, White Sands Missile Range Main Post, McGregor Range Base, Dona Ana Range Complex, Dripping Springs, Aguirre Springs, Portions of Organ Mountains Desert Peaks National Monument, Soledad Canyon, and San Augustin Pass.
info.instruction: Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
